text: Palmer is a city in Washington County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2020 census, 125 people lived there. == History == Palmer was founded in 1878. It was named for J. Palmer, a teacher. The first post office in Palmer was founded in June 1878. == Geography == Palmer is at (39.632737, -97.140028). According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. === Climate === Palmer has warm to hot (and often humid) summers and cold (sometimes severely cold) winters. According to the KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification says that Palmer has a humid continental climate, abbreviated "Dfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Palmer, Kansas == People == === 2020 census === The 2020 census said that there were 125 people, 55 households, and 37 families living in Palmer. Of the households, 78.2% owned their home and 21.8% rented their home. The median age was 41.1 years. Of the people, 98.4% were White, 0.8% were from some other race, and 0.8% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 0.8% of the people. === 2010 census === The 2010 census says that there were 111 people, 50 households, and 34 families living in the city. == References == == Other websites == ;City * Palmer - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 223, local school district ;Maps * Palmer City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Washington County, Kansas Category:1878 establishments in Kansas
title: Palmer, Kansas
